column3: Reverted to while (1) instead of loop, but as laanwj said the use of loop should perhaps be deprecated, or loop should be removed (not with this pull request).\n
Most changes look like minor code style changes, or personal preferences ("char\* x" vs "char *x", for example). Not sure that's worth the trouble of possibly conflicting with other changes.\n

Well the changes to net.cpp and serialize.h, and the comment update in init.cpp make sense.

Removing/adding spaces on the other hand (especially at the end of the line), meh...
I saw you guys removing left-over spaces, too ... so what's wrong with beeing thorough?\n
Removing spaces when you're modifying the line already is fine... removing it with no other changes, on the other hand...\n

It isn't even worth the discussion, I'm not searching for those parts in the code, but while merging commits I see those things with BeyondCompare. The need not to be in and so it should be simply okay to change this whithout any discussion. I won't remove any line-breaks and reverted that!\n
Will this get merged or shall I chery-pick the 3 changes and we leave unused spaces all over the code ;)?\n

Basically this is a whole bunch of unrelated changes, lumped into a single commit.

Even if we're talking about two one-line changes, consider putting such changes each in a separate commit _if they are logically unrelated_.

In particular, trim trailing whitespace should never be mixed in with other changes.  I created a separate pull request doing the trimming, see #1170.

Closing, but you
I'm fine with splitting this up into several pull-requests, if that is the wished procedure :).\n

Mind that @jgarzik is talking about multiple commits, not necessarily multiple pull requests. Multiple pull requests are good for completely unrelated things, but don't feel obligated to make a separate pull request for each warning message, for example.\n
Thanks for clarifiying even further, I don't feel disabused, but it helps me with helping the project!\n

Why do we have this `loop` macro? (defined as `for(;;)`). It's pretty confusing and doesn't add anything to the simple C syntax, does it?

Edit: this is just a general comment, not specific for your pull request...
I'm fine with removing it everywhere and usw while (1), but it was in and so I used it.\n
No need to remove it everywhere, but also no need to use it in new places IMO.\n
I tried to not rename any variables as I understood it makes little sense ^^, but if we have a #define for something we should use it or throw it out alltogether IMHO.\n
It's also possible to deprecate it for new code and phase it out slowly (as another Satoshi-ism). We don't like change-stuff-all-over-the-place commits.\n
